Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma (ccRCC): On gross examination, the tumor characteristically appears as a yellow mass.
Microscopically, the tumor is composed of cells exhibiting clear cytoplasm.
The pathogenesis is associated with the loss of the von Hippel-Lindau (VHL) tumor suppressor gene.
This carcinoma demonstrates a propensity for invasion into the renal vein.
The single most common presenting symptom of this renal malignancy is hematuria.
It is the most common histologic variant of renal cell carcinoma.
